results.content: Part two of this course freaking rocks. I've taken 3 other laravel courses so far and this instructor is fantastic. Part one is not any less wonderful, but it dives more into laravel as a framework for anyone who wants to understand the nuts and bolts of the program itself. I don't particularly have interest in that, i just want to build stuff. So overall, this is an extremely well rounded course that covers either aspect that a person could want to learn. If you don't really care about how the folders are structured or how it interacts on a code level with all of it's functions, skip to part two and start getting the practical knowledge of how to build a project.
